zh-CN.pageTitle: 2021年英国VAT新法规解读及赛盈分销平台VAT政策剖析
zh-CN.articleTitle: 2021年英国VAT新法规解读及赛盈分销平台VAT政策剖析
zh-CN.introText1: 当地时间2020年12月31日，英国结束了11个月的脱欧过渡期，正式告别欧盟。随即而来的，英国VAT政策也发生了重大的变更。
zh-CN.introText2: 英国与欧盟之间增设海关边境，这就意味着所有从英国发往欧盟国家以及从欧盟国家发往英国的商品都需要向海关进行申报。政策的变更无疑将直接影响欧洲站的卖家，今天，赛盈学院将深入解读英国VAT最新税务法规，并结合大家的疑问整理了一份纯干货。
zh-CN.section1Title: 一、英国VAT新政对欧洲站的卖家产生哪些影响?
zh-CN.subsection1_1Title: 1、英国脱欧后不能再与欧盟用同个EORI号清关
zh-CN.subsection1_1Text: 从2021年1月1日起，针对英国以及卖家打算运输商品的任何其他欧盟国家或地区，都将需要一个EORI，并且因为VAT税号是用来交增值税，EORI号是用来清关，因此卖家需要准备一个VAT税号和EORI号。
zh-CN.subsection1_2Title: 2、英国脱欧之后，卖家需要在英国和欧盟之间建立双库存
zh-CN.subsection1_2Text: 亚马逊FBA从2020年12月末开始就已经停止将货物在英国和欧盟之间派送，卖家的商品通过FBA进行销售，若仅在欧盟境内有库存，英国没有仓库，那么英国买家则无法查看商品和购买
zh-CN.subsection1_3Title: 3、B2B——英国境外库存向英国买家配送商品
zh-CN.subsection1_3Text: 若卖家从英国境外向英国买家配送商品，且该买家在英国登记了增值税（企业及机构买家），第三方平台无需代收和代缴增值税，已登记增值税的买家可通过其增值税申报单自行申报英国增值税。
zh-CN.subsection1_4Title: 4、B2C——自发货（从英国境外向英国买家配送商品）
zh-CN.subsection1_4Text: 若卖家从英国境外向英国买家配送商品，托运商品的价值不超过￡135（单件物品扣除运保费之后的净价值），必须由第三方电商平台代收代缴适用的增值税；托运商品的价值超过￡135（单件物品扣除运保费之后的净价值）则和目前一样，卖家仍需自行缴纳增值税和所有进口关税；对于托运价值低于￡15的商品，将不再享受的增值税豁免政策。
zh-CN.subsection1_5Title: 5、B2C——FBA或者海外仓（从英国境内的库存向英国买家配送商品）
zh-CN.subsection1_5Text: 对于在英国境内使用亚马逊物流和第三方配送方式的卖家，无论商品价值如何，都一律由第三方电商平台代扣代缴。
zh-CN.subsection1_6Title: 6、关于"进口税延迟核算"政策的理解
zh-CN.subsection1_6Text1: "进口税延迟核算"是针对英国脱欧后在英国注册VAT的商业主体出台进口税核算政策。即您无需在清关时先支付进口税（Import VAT），再抵扣，直接在季度申报时包含这方面数据即可。
zh-CN.subsection1_6Text2: 任何在英国注册VAT，并有进出口业务的生意主体都可以在2020年12月31日后选择使用。同时，卖家不需要额外进行申请。此项政策并非强制，您仍然可以选择之前货代代收进口税再抵扣的方式。但强烈建议选择延迟核算方式。这对您运营现金流有益，对VAT申报来说也不会出现平台代扣代缴后大量从税局退税情况。
zh-CN.process1: 流程1：通知货代在报关时选择Postponed VAT accounting；
zh-CN.process2: 流程2：每个月初在HMRC税局取得上个月清关情况报告；
zh-CN.process3: 流程3：季度申报时需包括3个月清关报告monthly statement postponed VAT数值和进口货值总额。
zh-CN.subsection1_6Text3: 原货代代收进口税的方式仍可继续使用，即清关时不选择PostponedVAT accounting，顾客支付进口税，收到C79，在申报时可再抵扣C79。
zh-CN.subsection1_7Title: 7、海外电商低税率未取消，但不做低税率计算
zh-CN.subsection1_7Text: 英国低税率并没有取消，卖家仍然可以使用低税率，但是平台代扣是按照标准税率扣税，不做低税率计算。英国税局对此项的回应是"商家可以选择随时离开低税率计划"。若卖家使用其他非代扣税金的电商平台或者自己的网站经营，还是按之前的方式正常申报，仍然可以在申报时按低税率计算并缴税。
zh-CN.section2Title: 二、亚马逊将于1月1日起代征收英国增值税
zh-CN.section2Text: 根据亚马逊后台新闻，亚马逊将负责向通过任何亚马逊店面对英国客户交付的以下商品销售收取英国增值税：
zh-CN.amazonListItem1: 从英国境外存放的库存中交付的货物，包裹价值最高不超过￡135；
zh-CN.amazonListItem2: 从英国国内库存的库存交付的商品，无论其价值如何，无论您处何地。
zh-CN.section2Text2: 无论使用哪种供应方式，亚马逊都会在结账时从客户那里计算并收取英国增值税，并将其直接汇给英国税务部门。您将不会在付款中收到英国增值税金额，也不需要将这些金额汇给英国税务机关。
zh-CN.subsection2_1Title: 1) 亚马逊会代扣销售增值税吗？
zh-CN.subsection2_1Text1: 自2021年1月1日起，亚马逊等电商平台针对海外电商将实行代扣代缴，即以前在申报后交付税局的VAT税金将直接在销售时由亚马逊等电商平台直接扣除。但此政策只针对海外电商，对于英国主体的公司或个体经营者不受影响。
zh-CN.subsection2_1Condition1: 由亚马逊代收代缴适用的增值税的情况：如果您通过英国境內的库存向英国买家配送商品，且您公司的成立地在英国境外，则必须由亚马逊代收代缴适用的增值税。这对在英国境內使用亚马逊物流的卖家和使用第三方配送方式的卖家均适用。
zh-CN.subsection2_1Condition2: 亚马逊不代收代缴增值税的情况：如果您从英国境外向英国买家配送商品，且该买家在英国登记了增值税（企业及机构买家），则亚马逊无需代收和代缴增值税。已登记增值税的买家可通过其增值税申报单自行申报英国。
zh-CN.subsection2_2Title: 2) 进项税金是否也由平台扣除？
zh-CN.subsection2_2Text: 进项税金不会被平台代扣，亚马逊只代扣销售VAT，不做抵扣申报。但英国税局针对脱欧引用了"进口税延迟核算"政策。即商家无需在进口时支付进口税，这样也不会产生需要抵扣的进项税金。
zh-CN.subsection2_3Title: 3) 代扣代缴后是否还需要做VAT申报？
zh-CN.subsection2_3Text: 只要您注册了英国VAT还是需要按HMRC要求准时申报。您仍需要在VAT申报中体现您的销售额，使用"进口税延迟核算"方式报关的数据，及其他经营数据。只是您被平台代扣的销售部分不会被计算包含在VAT申报的"应缴税金"栏目中。
zh-CN.subsection2_4Title: 4) 在新的增值税法规中，有几项变化值得卖家注意：
zh-CN.change1: 对于销售价值低于￡15的商品，目前享受的增值税豁免政策被取消。现在，您销售的商品均需缴纳英国增值税。
zh-CN.change2: 如果这些销售商品的货件价值不超过￡135，必须由亚马逊代收和代缴英国增值税。
zh-CN.change3: 如果销售商品的货件价值超过￡135，则和目前一样，您仍需自行缴纳增值税和所有进口关税。
zh-CN.subsection2_5Title: 5) 亚马逊欧洲站卖家需要做好以下三大准备：
zh-CN.preparation1: 保证英国及欧盟都有库存。卖家可以拆分库存，并分别发送至英国和欧盟，进而保障英国和欧盟销售，确保在2021年1月1日起生效的新边境两侧都有充足的库存。
zh-CN.preparation2: 准备VAT税号。若跨境运输商品并在当地储存，卖家需要提供存放这些商品的国家或地区的增值税税号。
zh-CN.preparation3: 获取EORI号。EORI指的是在欧洲国家内凡是有经济活动，尤其是进出口生意的企业，必备的一个登记号。从2021年1月1日起，针对英国以及卖家打算运输商品的任何其他欧盟国家或地区，都将需要一个EORI。
zh-CN.section3Title: 三、eBay也将于1月1日起代征收英国增值税
zh-CN.section3Text1: 日前，eBay发布公告，将从2021年1月1日起代征代缴英国增值税。适用情形包括：
zh-CN.ebayListItem1: 对于进口至英国并销售给英国境内消费者且价值不超过135英镑的货物；
zh-CN.ebayListItem2: 对于非英国企业的卖家、提前仓储于英国境内并销售给英国消费者的货物。英国将取消目前针对进口至英国且价值不超过15英镑的低价值货物享受的增值税免征待遇。
zh-CN.section3Text2: 同时，从2021年3月1日起，eBay将强制要求所有在eBay英国及eBay欧洲站点上的刊登提供增值税税率。因此，卖家应尽快检查并修正在eBay英国站点或任何eBay欧洲站点上的刊登以提供适用的增值税税率。如果卖家没有任何欧盟或英国的增值税号码（VAT ID），则当修改现有刊登或创建新刊登时，卖家可以在增值税税率栏填写0%。
zh-CN.section4Title: 四、赛盈分销平台针对英国VAT采取相关措施
zh-CN.section4Text: 为符合英国增值税新规的要求，赛盈分销平台将于近期升级相关功能模块，对英国路向的分销商品进行调整，并要求购买英国路向分销商品的分销商提供相关信息，具体功能内容及要求如下：
zh-CN.subsection4_1Title: 1) 赛盈分销平台发货区域为UK的商品价格将进行调整
zh-CN.subsection4_1Text: 赛盈分销平台针对发货区域为UK的商品，将要求供应商在发布商品时计算并列明相应的增值税税额（VAT税），调整后的商品价格为含税价，分销商在进行订单结算时能够明显区分商品应缴纳的VAT税费，调整后的新功能上线时间将在近期内另行通知。
zh-CN.subsection4_2Title: 2) 赛盈分销平台将上线分销商VAT税号登记功能
zh-CN.subsection4_2Text1: 按照英国增值税新规的要求，赛盈分销平台将要求分销商披露其是否注册了英国增值税税号，以便赛盈分销平台确定正确的增值税处理方法。平台近期将上线分销商VAT税号登记功能收集分销商的英国增值税税号并进行在线核验，敬请期待。
zh-CN.subsection4_2Text2: 关于分销商是否提供相关VAT税号进而采取相应措施，将会出现以下两种情况：
zh-CN.situation1Desc: 购买商品时，提供VAT税号的分销商，按照B2B模式执行（分销商申请发票，供应商开票）。例如：供应商提交的商品价格为不含税价100元；平台增加20%VAT税费，结算价为120元；分销商提供VAT税号，120元购买商品，后可申请发票，其中产品金额为100元，VAT税为20元；发票由分销商申请，供应商开予分销商；网络电子发票功能以后续公告时间为准；平台结算120元给供应商。
zh-CN.situation2Desc1: 购买商品时，无法提供VAT税号的分销商，按照B2C模式执行。情形包括：情形1：若是英国个人身份，平台将开票给英国个人；情形2：若是年收入不超过8.5万英镑的英国公司，平台需要开票给此英国公司分销商；示例同上，平台开票金额、结算及VAT处理按情形不同给出。
zh-CN.subsection4_3Title: 3) 分销商在赛盈分销平台下单的商品需补开增值税发票说明
zh-CN.subsection4_3Text: 在2021年1月1日至2021年1月20日期间下单采购的发货区域为UK的商品，其结算价格为未含税价格，商品详情页已展示未含税标识。若分销商未留意，错误以为价格含税并在第三方平台销售造成损失，分销商可自本通知发布之日起至2021年1月31日期间联系业务经理说明情况，并按要求提供相关资料，经审核通过后，分销商可申请补开增值税发票。若分销商未在前述期间联系，平台不再受理。
zh-CN.qa1Question: 1) 赛盈分销平台何时正式执行VAT相关政策？
zh-CN.qa1Answer: 根据英国税法及海关总署公告，2021年1月1日起，英国已生效新版VAT税收政策。赛盈平台在2021年1月1日至2021年1月20日期间销售的商品价格，均为未含税价格，但在发货区域为UK的商品详情页会提示客户，商品详情页展示的价格为未含税价格。若在此期间未留意，导致在第三方平台销售时按错误价格结算，卖家可在公告发布日至2021年1月31日期间联系业务经理协商处理。至于何时在原商品价格基础上增加20% VAT，将另行公告通知。
zh-CN.qa2Question: 2) 需要增加VAT税额的商品条件是什么？
zh-CN.qa2ListItem1: 赛盈平台发货区域为英国的商品；
zh-CN.qa2ListItem2: 商品收件地址位于英国境内。
zh-CN.qa3Question: 3) 后续对于商品价格加VAT税的调整，对赛盈商城选品分销有什么影响？
zh-CN.qa3Answer: 平台会根据政策调整相关模块功能，仅针对发货区域为UK的商品进行含VAT税的定价，商品的搜索页面、商品详情页、列表页都不受影响。分销商只会看到含VAT的定价。
zh-CN.qa4Answer: 分销商在购买商品支付订单时，符合税收条件的订单会自动结算出订单金额与税额，与商品订单共同支付。有VAT税号的分销商，后续可申请发票（网站上线电子发票功能，见平台公告）。
zh-CN.qa5Question: 5) 赛盈分销平台的VAT税收政策是否会影响到分销商在英国区域销售？
zh-CN.qa5Answer: 对于2021年度的英国增值税新政，所有在英国区域正规销售的卖家统一执行此税收政策，公平竞争；税收合规化也有利于在英国进行的跨境电商贸易。
zh-CN.qa6Answer: 赛盈平台的VAT功能暂未发布，预计第一季度末上线，不影响VAT申报。上线后可按季度报税。
zh-CN.qa7Answer: 以订单为维度，按每个订单实际支付金额的20%计算VAT。
zh-CN.qa8Question: 8) 发票金额包括哪些项目？
zh-CN.qa8Answer: 包括商品价格和对应的VAT税额。
zh-CN.qa9Question: 9) 有VAT税号的公司卖家，需要提供哪些信息？
zh-CN.qa10Question: 10) 无VAT税号的个人卖家，需要提供哪些信息？
zh-CN.conclusionText1: 现如今，英国脱欧已成事实，面临VAT政策变更的种种问题，各大跨境电商平台都已陆续开展相关应对措施，赛盈分销平台也不例外。卖家需要跟上平台最新资讯和相关政策，及时调整战略，方能顺利开拓欧洲市场。
zh-CN.conclusionText2: 英国VAT政策的分享告一段落，关于赛盈分销平台VAT政策的相关事宜若后续仍有疑问，欢迎联系业务经理获取更全面的答疑。

en.pageTitle: Interpretation of the New UK VAT Regulations in 2021 and Analysis of Saleyee Distribution Platform VAT Policy
en.articleTitle: Interpretation of the New UK VAT Regulations in 2021 and Analysis of Saleyee Distribution Platform VAT Policy
en.introText1: On December 31, 2020, local time, the UK ended its 11-month Brexit transition period and officially bid farewell to the EU. Subsequently, the UK VAT policy also underwent significant changes.
en.introText2: The UK and the EU have established customs borders, which means that all goods shipped from the UK to EU countries and from EU countries to the UK need to be declared to customs. The policy changes will undoubtedly directly affect European station sellers. Today, Saleyee Academy will provide an in-depth interpretation of the latest UK VAT tax regulations and compile a pure dry goods summary based on everyone's questions.
en.section1Title: 1. What impact will the new UK VAT policy have on European station sellers?
en.subsection1_1Title: 1. After Brexit, the UK and the EU can no longer use the same EORI number for customs clearance
en.subsection1_1Text: Starting from January 1, 2021, for the UK and any other EU country or region where sellers intend to ship goods, an EORI will be required. Since VAT numbers are used to pay value-added tax and EORI numbers are used for customs clearance, sellers need to prepare both a VAT number and an EORI number.
en.subsection1_2Title: 2. After Brexit, sellers need to establish dual inventory between the UK and the EU
en.subsection1_2Text: Amazon FBA has stopped delivering goods between the UK and the EU since the end of December 2020. If sellers sell goods through FBA with inventory only in the EU and no warehouse in the UK, UK buyers will not be able to view or purchase the goods.
en.subsection1_3Title: 3. B2B - Shipping goods from UK overseas inventory to UK buyers
en.subsection1_3Text: If sellers ship goods from overseas to UK buyers and the buyer is registered for VAT in the UK (corporate and institutional buyers), third-party platforms do not need to collect and pay VAT. Registered VAT buyers can declare UK VAT through their VAT return.
en.subsection1_4Title: 4. B2C - Self-fulfillment (shipping goods from overseas to UK buyers)
en.subsection1_4Text: If sellers ship goods from overseas to UK buyers, for goods with a shipment value not exceeding £135 (net value after deducting shipping and insurance costs for a single item), the applicable VAT must be collected and paid by the third-party e-commerce platform. For goods with a shipment value exceeding £135 (net value after deducting shipping and insurance costs for a single item), it remains the same as before, and sellers still need to pay VAT and all import duties themselves. For goods with a shipment value below £15, the VAT exemption policy will no longer apply.
en.subsection1_5Title: 5. B2C - FBA or overseas warehouse (shipping goods from UK domestic inventory to UK buyers)
en.subsection1_5Text: For sellers using Amazon logistics and third-party delivery methods within the UK, regardless of the value of the goods, all will be withheld and paid by the third-party e-commerce platform.
en.subsection1_6Text1: "Postponed VAT Accounting" is an import tax accounting policy introduced for business entities registered for VAT in the UK after Brexit. You do not need to pay import VAT at customs clearance and then deduct it, but directly include this data in your quarterly filing.
en.subsection1_6Text2: Any business entity registered for VAT in the UK with import and export business can choose to use it after December 31, 2020. Sellers do not need to apply additionally. This policy is not mandatory, and you can still choose the previous method of freight forwarders collecting import VAT for deduction. However, it is strongly recommended to choose the postponed accounting method, which is beneficial for your cash flow and will not result in large tax refunds from the tax authority after platform withholding and payment.
en.process1: Process 1: Notify freight forwarders to select Postponed VAT accounting at customs declaration;
en.process2: Process 2: Obtain the previous month's customs clearance report from HMRC at the beginning of each month;
en.process3: Process 3: Quarterly filing needs to include 3 months of customs clearance reports, monthly statement postponed VAT values, and total import value.
en.subsection1_6Text3: The original method of freight forwarders collecting import VAT can still be used, that is, not selecting Postponed VAT accounting at customs clearance, customers pay import VAT, receive C79, and can deduct C79 during filing.
en.subsection1_7Title: 7. Overseas e-commerce low tax rate is not cancelled, but low tax rate calculation is not performed
en.subsection1_7Text: The UK low tax rate has not been cancelled, and sellers can still use the low tax rate, but the platform withholds tax at the standard rate and does not calculate the low tax rate. The UK tax authority's response to this is that "merchants can choose to leave the low tax rate plan at any time." If sellers use other non-withholding tax e-commerce platforms or operate their own websites, they still follow the previous method for normal filing and can still calculate and pay taxes at the low rate during filing.
en.section2Title: 2. Amazon will start collecting UK VAT on January 1st
en.section2Text: According to Amazon backend news, Amazon will be responsible for collecting UK VAT on the following goods sold to UK customers through any Amazon store:
en.amazonListItem1: Goods delivered from inventory stored overseas with a package value not exceeding £135;
en.amazonListItem2: Goods delivered from domestic UK inventory, regardless of their value, regardless of your location.
en.section2Text2: Regardless of the supply method used, Amazon will calculate and collect UK VAT from customers at checkout and remit it directly to the UK tax authority. You will not receive the UK VAT amount in the payment, nor do you need to remit these amounts to the UK tax authority.
en.subsection2_1Text1: Starting from January 1, 2021, e-commerce platforms such as Amazon will implement withholding and payment for overseas e-commerce, meaning that VAT funds previously paid to the tax authority after filing will now be directly deducted by e-commerce platforms such as Amazon at the time of sale. However, this policy only applies to overseas e-commerce and does not affect UK-based companies or individual operators.
en.subsection2_1Condition1: Situations where Amazon collects and pays applicable VAT: If you ship goods from domestic UK inventory to UK buyers and your company is established overseas, you must have Amazon collect and pay applicable VAT. This applies to sellers using Amazon logistics in the UK and those using third-party delivery methods.
en.subsection2_1Condition2: Situations where Amazon does not collect and pay VAT: If you ship goods from overseas to UK buyers and the buyer is registered for VAT in the UK (corporate and institutional buyers), Amazon does not need to collect and pay VAT. Registered VAT buyers can declare UK VAT through their VAT return.
en.subsection2_2Title: 2) Will input tax also be deducted by the platform?
en.subsection2_2Text: Input tax will not be deducted by the platform. Amazon only withholds sales VAT and does not make deduction filings. However, the UK tax authority has introduced the "Postponed VAT Accounting" policy for Brexit. This means businesses do not need to pay import tax at importation, so there will be no input tax to deduct.
en.subsection2_3Title: 3) Do you still need to file VAT returns after withholding and payment?
en.subsection2_3Text: As long as you are registered for UK VAT, you still need to file on time as required by HMRC. You still need to reflect your sales in the VAT return, data from customs declarations using the "Postponed VAT Accounting" method, and other business data. However, the sales portion withheld by the platform will not be calculated and included in the "tax payable" section of the VAT return.
en.subsection2_4Title: 4) In the new VAT regulations, there are several changes that sellers should note:
en.change1: For goods with a sales value below £15, the current VAT exemption policy has been cancelled. Now, all goods you sell must pay UK VAT.
en.change2: If the shipment value of these sold goods does not exceed £135, UK VAT must be collected and paid by Amazon.
en.change3: If the shipment value of sold goods exceeds £135, it remains the same as before, and you still need to pay VAT and all import duties yourself.
en.subsection2_5Title: 5) Amazon European station sellers need to make the following three preparations:
en.preparation1: Ensure inventory in both the UK and the EU. Sellers can split inventory and send it to the UK and EU separately, thereby ensuring sales in the UK and EU, and ensuring sufficient inventory on both sides of the new border that takes effect from January 1, 2021.
en.preparation2: Prepare VAT numbers. If shipping goods across borders and storing them locally, sellers need to provide VAT numbers for the country or region where these goods are stored.
en.preparation3: Obtain EORI numbers. EORI refers to a registration number that is essential for enterprises with economic activities in European countries, especially import and export businesses. Starting from January 1, 2021, an EORI will be required for the UK and any other EU country or region where sellers intend to ship goods.
en.section3Title: 3. eBay will also start collecting UK VAT on January 1st
en.section3Text1: Recently, eBay announced that it will start collecting and paying UK VAT from January 1, 2021. Applicable situations include:
en.ebayListItem1: Goods imported to the UK and sold to UK consumers with a value not exceeding £135;
en.ebayListItem2: For non-UK enterprise sellers who pre-store goods in the UK and sell to UK consumers. The UK will cancel the current VAT exemption for low-value goods imported to the UK with a value not exceeding £15.
en.section3Text2: At the same time, from March 1, 2021, eBay will mandate that all listings on eBay UK and eBay European sites provide VAT rates. Therefore, sellers should check and modify listings on eBay UK sites or any eBay European sites as soon as possible to provide applicable VAT rates. If sellers do not have any EU or UK VAT numbers (VAT ID), they can fill in 0% in the VAT rate field when modifying existing listings or creating new listings.
en.section4Title: 4. Saleyee Distribution Platform's Measures for UK VAT
en.section4Text: To comply with the requirements of the new UK VAT regulations, the Saleyee Distribution Platform will upgrade relevant functional modules in the near future, adjust distribution goods to the UK, and require distributors purchasing UK-bound distribution goods to provide relevant information. The specific functional content and requirements are as follows:
en.subsection4_1Title: 1) The price of goods shipped to the UK region on the Saleyee Distribution Platform will be adjusted
en.subsection4_1Text: For goods shipped to the UK region, the Saleyee Distribution Platform will require suppliers to calculate and specify the corresponding VAT amount when publishing goods. The adjusted product price will be tax-inclusive, and distributors will be able to clearly distinguish the VAT tax payable for goods during order settlement. The launch time of the new function will be announced separately in the near future.
en.subsection4_2Title: 2) The Saleyee Distribution Platform will launch a distributor VAT number registration function
en.subsection4_2Text1: According to the requirements of the new UK VAT regulations, the Saleyee Distribution Platform will require distributors to disclose whether they have registered for a UK VAT number so that the platform can determine the correct VAT processing method. The platform will launch a distributor VAT number registration function in the near future to collect distributors' UK VAT numbers and conduct online verification. Please look forward to it.
en.subsection4_2Text2: Regarding whether distributors provide relevant VAT numbers and take corresponding measures, the following two situations will arise:
en.situation1Desc: When purchasing goods, distributors who provide VAT numbers will follow the B2B model (distributors apply for invoices, suppliers issue invoices). For example: If the supplier submits a product price of 100 yuan excluding tax; the platform adds 20% VAT, making the settlement price 120 yuan; distributors provide VAT numbers, purchase goods for 120 yuan, and can then apply for invoices, with the product amount being 100 yuan and VAT being 20 yuan; invoices are applied for by distributors and issued by suppliers; the online electronic invoice function will be announced at a later time; the platform settles 120 yuan to the supplier.
en.situation2Desc1: When purchasing goods, distributors who cannot provide VAT numbers will follow the B2C model. Scenarios include: Scenario 1: If it is an individual in the UK, the platform will issue an invoice to the UK individual; Scenario 2: If it is a UK company with annual revenue not exceeding £85,000, the platform needs to issue an invoice to this UK company distributor; the example is the same as above, with invoice amounts, settlements, and VAT processing given according to different scenarios.
en.subsection4_3Title: 3) Explanation of supplementary VAT invoice issuance for goods ordered by distributors on the Saleyee Distribution Platform
en.subsection4_3Text: For goods shipped to the UK region ordered between January 1, 2021, and January 20, 2021, the settlement price is the pre-tax price, and the pre-tax identification has been displayed on the product details page. If distributors fail to notice and mistakenly believe the price is tax-inclusive, causing losses when selling on third-party platforms, distributors can contact their account manager to explain the situation and provide relevant materials as required between the date of this notice and January 31, 2021. After approval, distributors can apply for supplementary VAT invoice issuance. If distributors do not contact within the aforementioned period, the platform will no longer accept applications.
en.section5Title: 5. Saleyee Distribution Platform VAT Policy Q&A
en.qa1Question: 1) When will the Saleyee Distribution Platform officially implement VAT-related policies?
en.qa1Answer: According to UK tax law and customs announcements, the new UK VAT tax policy took effect on January 1, 2021. Between January 1, 2021, and January 20, 2021, the prices of goods sold on the Saleyee platform were all pre-tax prices, but for goods shipped to the UK region, the product details page will prompt customers that the price displayed on the product details page is pre-tax. If you fail to notice during this period and settle at the wrong price when selling on third-party platforms, sellers can contact their account manager for consultation and handling between the date of the announcement and January 31, 2021. As for when to add 20% VAT to the original product price, a separate announcement will be made.
en.qa2Question: 2) What are the conditions for goods that need to add VAT amounts?
en.qa2ListItem1: Goods shipped to the UK region on the Saleyee platform;
en.qa2ListItem2: Goods with delivery addresses located in the UK.
en.qa3Question: 3) How will subsequent adjustments to product prices with VAT affect product selection and distribution on the Saleyee mall?
en.qa3Answer: The platform will adjust relevant module functions according to policy changes, only pricing goods shipped to the UK region with VAT included. The search page, product details page, and listing page of goods will not be affected. Distributors will only see VAT-inclusive pricing.
en.qa4Question: 4) Who bears the VAT amount generated?
en.qa4Answer: When distributors purchase goods and pay orders, orders that meet tax conditions will automatically calculate the order amount and tax amount, which will be paid together with the product order. Distributors with VAT numbers can apply for invoices later (the website's electronic invoice function will be announced).
en.qa5Question: 5) Will the Saleyee Distribution Platform's VAT tax policy affect distributors' sales in the UK region?
en.qa5Answer: For the UK VAT policy in 2021, all sellers who sell regularly in the UK region will uniformly implement this tax policy, fair competition; tax compliance is also beneficial for cross-border e-commerce trade in the UK.
en.qa6Question: 6) How to apply for related VAT invoices?
en.qa6Answer: The VAT function of the Saleyee platform has not yet been launched, expected to go online at the end of the first quarter, without affecting VAT filing. After going online, tax returns can be filed quarterly.
en.qa7Question: 7) What items does the VAT payment include?
en.qa7Answer: Based on orders, VAT is calculated at 20% of the actual payment amount for each order.
en.qa8Question: 8) What items does the invoice amount include?
en.qa8Answer: Includes product price and corresponding VAT amount.
en.qa9Question: 9) What information do company sellers with VAT numbers need to provide?
en.qa9ListItem3: Country where the company is located;
en.qa9ListItem9: Relevant screenshots from the store backend.
en.qa10Question: 10) What information do individual sellers without VAT numbers need to provide?
en.conclusionText1: Nowadays, Brexit has become a fact, and facing various issues arising from VAT policy changes, major cross-border e-commerce platforms have gradually launched relevant response measures, and the Saleyee Distribution Platform is no exception. Sellers need to keep up with the platform's latest information and related policies, adjust strategies in a timely manner, and smoothly expand the European market.
en.conclusionText2: The sharing of UK VAT policies has come to an end. If there are still questions about the Saleyee Distribution Platform's VAT policy, please contact your account manager for more comprehensive answers.
